intro: Matelea ruiz-pavonii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant is known for its fragrant blooms and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Matelea ruiz-pavonii is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
